note_metadata.text:
Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
No Known Allergies / Adverse Drug Reactions
 
Attending: ___
 
___ Complaint:
Scheduled admit for cycle 2 of ICE
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None
 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with a history of follicular 

lymphoma stage IIIA s/p CHOP x 6 in ___ followed by CVP and 
then rituximab x 6 in ___, now with transformed DLBCL who 
presents with for cycle 2 of ICE therapy. Per report, she has 
significant  neck and upper thoracic involvement, as well as 
mesenteric  involvement.  She underwent her first cycle of ICE 
without complications ___ and since then has been getting 
rituxan and neupogen. 

On arrival to the floor, patient is feeling well.  Her only 
complaint from her previous session of chemo was mild stomach 
upset.  She denies any fevers/chills, headache, vision changes, 
sore throat, SOB, CP, abd pain, N/V/D, dysuria or new rashes.

 
Past Medical History:
Follicular lymphoma stage IIA with disease recurrence
- ___ developed worsening musculoskeletal back pain, early 
satiety, hypoalbuminemia and found to have mesenteric mass
- ?___ ex lap with 15 cm lobulated mass involving the 
duodenum, retroperitoneum and celiac access.  Biopsies showed 
Follicular lymphomas grade II/III.  Reportedly negative staging 
Gallium scan. CD10+ BCL2+
- ___ completed 6 cycles CHOP, complications included 
SVC/innominate thrombus (tPA)
- ___ CT showed persistent 7 x 3.5 x 9 cm oblong mass, bone
marrow at completion was negative for lymphomatous involvement.
- ___ PET-CT with very slight amount of increased tracer
activity within the posterior left supraclavicular region. No
other areas of FDG avid disease were noted 
- ___ through ___ per records she was treated with CVP
followed by course of single agent Rituxan
- ___ through ___ surveillance imaging with no evidence of
recurrent disease, stable mesenteric mass.
- ___ abdominal pain led to CT with no change in mass size,
increased conspicuity of nodular borders
- ___ PET-CT with L. hilar LN PET-avid to SUV 7.9, otherwise
stable mesenteric mass with low level SUV 2.2 stable since 
prior.
- ___ CT torso showed persistent mesenteric and left hilar
lymphadenopathy. Stable right middle lobe small focus of ground
glass opacity and adjacent subpleural fat hypertrophy, 
suggestive
of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst.  
- ___ Presented to PCP ___ ___iscomfort. 
Exam
revealed new adenopathy. Labs notable for LDH 341, WBC 10.1,
normal differential, PLT 452. 
- ___ PET CT revealed, "Large left cervical,
supraclavicular, mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and 
retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric 
lymphadenopathy, all of which is markedly FDG-avid and 
concerning for
lymphoma." SUVmax 35.5.
- ___iopsy revealed diffuse large B cell
lymphoma, CD20+ CD10+ lambda restricted. MIB and cytogenetics 
are pending
- ___ C1D1 ICE

PAST MEDICAL/SURGICAL HISTORY:  
Cerebral Aneurysm s/p coil ___ c/b hyperthesia of R V1/V2 
(*Known slight CN VI palsy & mild proptosis of R eye)
Hypogammaglobulinemia, 
Mild GERD
OA / LBP
Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth
Trochanteric Bursitis
s/p Excisional Bx L Cervical Lymph Node
s/p L total knee replacement ___
s/p I&D Labial Abscess
s/p Excision Cyst R ___ Digit of Hand

 
Social History:
___
Family History:
NC
 
Physical Exam:
ADMISSION PHYSICAL EXAM:
VS: T 98.3, HR 92, BP 124/78, R 20, 97%RA
General: well-appearing but elderly lady, reclined in bed, NAD
HEENT: Normocephalic, R eye ptosis, 1mm vesicle on posterior 
soft palate(chronic per patient), otherwise OP is clear
Neck: 3cm x 1cm L anterior LN, no thyromegaly   
CV: RRR, no r/g/m 
Lungs: CTA b/l
Abdomen: Soft, NT, ND, +BS
Ext: WWP, ___ edema L > R, chronic venous stasis changes noted 
on b/l shins    
Neuro: Notable for R CN VI palsy & diminished sensation in CN 
V-1, also sluggish R CN III response to direct & indirect 
illumination, otherwise CN's grossly intact, intact muscle 
strength all extremities, intact light sensation b/l ___
Skin: R pheresis line c/d/i

DISCHARGE PHYSICAL EXAM:
VS: T 98.6, HR 95, BP 114/76, R 20, 97%RA
General: well-appearing but elderly lady, reclined in bed, NAD
HEENT: Normocephalic, R eye ptosis, 1mm vesicle on posterior 
soft palate(chronic per patient), otherwise OP is clear
Neck: 3cm x 1cm L anterior LN, no thyromegaly   
CV: RRR, no r/g/m 
Lungs: CTA b/l
Abdomen: Soft, NT, ND, +BS
Ext: WWP, ___ edema L > R, chronic venous stasis changes noted 
on b/l shins    
Neuro: Notable for R CN VI palsy & diminished sensation in CN 
V-1, also sluggish R CN III response to direct & indirect 
illumination, otherwise CN's grossly intact, intact muscle 
strength all extremities, intact light sensation b/l ___
Skin: R pheresis line c/d/i

 
Pertinent Results:
ADMISSION LABS:
---------------
___ 10:00AM   WBC-5.7 RBC-3.14* HGB-9.8* HCT-28.4* MCV-90 
MCH-31.3 MCHC-34.7 RDW-14.4
___ 10:00AM   NEUTS-72.1* LYMPHS-17.1* MONOS-10.1 EOS-0.2 
BASOS-0.5
___ 10:00AM   PLT COUNT-232#
___ 10:00AM   ___ PTT-29.3 ___
___ 10:00AM   UREA N-11 CREAT-0.7 SODIUM-141 POTASSIUM-4.4 
CHLORIDE-105 TOTAL CO2-25 ANION GAP-15
___ 10:00AM   ALT(SGPT)-17 AST(SGOT)-23 LD(LDH)-311* ALK 
PHOS-108* TOT BILI-0.2
___ 10:00AM   ALBUMIN-3.9 CALCIUM-8.6 PHOSPHATE-3.2 
MAGNESIUM-2.1
___ 01:00PM URINE  BLOOD-NEG NITRITE-NEG PROTEIN-NEG 
GLUCOSE-NEG KETONE-NEG BILIRUBIN-NEG UROBILNGN-NEG PH-6.0 
LEUK-NEG
___ 01:00PM URINE  COLOR-Straw APPEAR-Clear SP ___

DISCHARGE LABS:
---------------
___ 05:00AM BLOOD WBC-4.8 RBC-3.06* Hgb-9.6* Hct-28.5* 
MCV-93 MCH-31.3 MCHC-33.6 RDW-15.5 Plt ___
___ 05:00AM BLOOD Neuts-78.2* Lymphs-16.9* Monos-4.5 
Eos-0.1 Baso-0.4
___ 05:00AM BLOOD ___ 05:00AM BLOOD Glucose-125* UreaN-14 Creat-0.7 Na-142 
K-4.1 Cl-107 HCO3-26 AnGap-13
___ 05:00AM BLOOD ALT-15 AST-14 LD(LDH)-246 AlkPhos-102 
TotBili-0.1
___ 05:00AM BLOOD Calcium-8.6 Phos-3.3 Mg-2.3 UricAcd-3.2
 
Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with a history of follicular 
lymphoma stage IIIA s/p CHOP x 6 in ___ followed by CVP and 
then rituximab x 6 in ___, now with transformed DLBCL who 
presents with for cycle 2 of ICE therapy

# DLBCL: Here for c2 of R-ICE.  c1 R-ICE started ___ and 
completed without complications. She will need Neupogen D5-12 to 
support ___.  Will continue bactrim, acyclovir and allopurinol 
for ppx.  Plan for PET-CT after ___ cycle to assess disease 
response to therapy.  

CHRONIC ISSUES:
===============
#H/o LLE edema and cellulitis: the pt reports chronic b/l lower 
extremity edema s/p L TKR in ___ U/S was negative for DVT 
on her most recent admission. She also has chronioc venous 
stasis and a h/o of MRSA infections (boils, abdominal and 
labial) and on her most recent admission was treated empirically 
with amoxicillin and bactrim. Currently without signs of 
infections and ___ edema at her baseline.

# Migraines: Takes coffee + indomethacin at home. She received 1 
dose of fioricet for headache during her hospitalization with 
relief of her symptoms.  

# h/o SVC syndrome s/p thrombectomy. Currently no clinical 
evidence SVC thrombus.  She received heparin SC as her platelets 
remained >50 during her hospitalization.

# HLD: continued home statin.

# Mood: continued home venlafaxine. 

 
Medications on Admission:
The Preadmission Medication list is accurate and complete.
1. Ondansetron 8 mg PO Q8H:PRN nausea 
2. Gabapentin 900 mg PO BID 
3. Allopurinol ___ mg PO DAILY 
4. Prochlorperazine 10 mg PO Q6H:PRN nausea 
5. Pravastatin 10 mg PO DAILY 
6. Furosemide 20 mg PO DAILY 
7. Acyclovir 400 mg PO Q8H 
8. OxycoDONE (Immediate Release)  5 mg PO Q6H:PRN pain 
9. Omeprazole 20 mg PO DAILY 
10. Venlafaxine 25 mg PO BID 
11. Sulfameth/Trimethoprim SS 1 TAB PO DAILY 
12. Aspirin 81 mg PO DAILY 
13. Multivitamins 1 TAB PO DAILY 

 
Discharge Medications:
1. Acyclovir 400 mg PO Q8H 
2. Allopurinol ___ mg PO DAILY 
3. Aspirin 81 mg PO DAILY 
4. Furosemide 20 mg PO DAILY 
5. Gabapentin 900 mg PO BID 
6. Multivitamins 1 TAB PO DAILY 
7. Omeprazole 20 mg PO DAILY 
8. Ondansetron 8 mg PO Q8H:PRN nausea 
9. OxycoDONE (Immediate Release)  5 mg PO Q6H:PRN pain 
10. Pravastatin 10 mg PO DAILY 
11. Prochlorperazine 10 mg PO Q6H:PRN nausea 
12. Sulfameth/Trimethoprim SS 1 TAB PO DAILY 
13. Venlafaxine 25 mg PO BID 

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Diffuse Large B cell lymphoma

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
                             ___ MD ___
 
Completed by: ___

Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___

Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
No Known Allergies / Adverse Drug Reactions
 
Attending: ___
 
___ Complaint:
Scheduled admit for cycle 2 of ICE
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None
 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with a history of follicular 

lymphoma stage IIIA s/p CHOP x 6 in ___ followed by CVP and 
then rituximab x 6 in ___, now with transformed DLBCL who 
presents with for cycle 2 of ICE therapy. Per report, she has 
significant  neck and upper thoracic involvement, as well as 
mesenteric  involvement.  She underwent her first cycle of ICE 
without complications ___ and since then has been getting 
rituxan and neupogen. 

On arrival to the floor, patient is feeling well.  Her only 
complaint from her previous session of chemo was mild stomach 
upset.  She denies any fevers/chills, headache, vision changes, 
sore throat, SOB, CP, abd pain, N/V/D, dysuria or new rashes.

 
Past Medical History:
Follicular lymphoma stage IIA with disease recurrence
- ___ developed worsening musculoskeletal back pain, early 
satiety, hypoalbuminemia and found to have mesenteric mass
- ?___ ex lap with 15 cm lobulated mass involving the 
duodenum, retroperitoneum and celiac access.  Biopsies showed 
Follicular lymphomas grade II/III.  Reportedly negative staging 
Gallium scan. CD10+ BCL2+
- ___ completed 6 cycles CHOP, complications included 
SVC/innominate thrombus (tPA)
- ___ CT showed persistent 7 x 3.5 x 9 cm oblong mass, bone
marrow at completion was negative for lymphomatous involvement.
- ___ PET-CT with very slight amount of increased tracer
activity within the posterior left supraclavicular region. No
other areas of FDG avid disease were noted 
- ___ through ___ per records she was treated with CVP
followed by course of single agent Rituxan
- ___ through ___ surveillance imaging with no evidence of
recurrent disease, stable mesenteric mass.
- ___ abdominal pain led to CT with no change in mass size,
increased conspicuity of nodular borders
- ___ PET-CT with L. hilar LN PET-avid to SUV 7.9, otherwise
stable mesenteric mass with low level SUV 2.2 stable since 
prior.
- ___ CT torso showed persistent mesenteric and left hilar
lymphadenopathy. Stable right middle lobe small focus of ground
glass opacity and adjacent subpleural fat hypertrophy, 
suggestive
of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst.  
- ___ Presented to PCP ___ ___iscomfort. 
Exam
revealed new adenopathy. Labs notable for LDH 341, WBC 10.1,
normal differential, PLT 452. 
- ___ PET CT revealed, "Large left cervical,
supraclavicular, mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and 
retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric 
lymphadenopathy, all of which is markedly FDG-avid and 
concerning for
lymphoma." SUVmax 35.5.
- ___iopsy revealed diffuse large B cell
lymphoma, CD20+ CD10+ lambda restricted. MIB and cytogenetics 
are pending
- ___ C1D1 ICE

PAST MEDICAL/SURGICAL HISTORY:

Trochanteric Bursitis

___

NC
